_header: Take no God but One in heaven
Note:
For the four Latin hexameters roughly translated here, see Walther (1969)
XWalther, Hans. Initia carmina ac versuum medii aevi posterioris latinorum. Göttingen, 1959; 2nd ed. 1969, no. 19669, 9121; and cf. 1814
Subjects: Ten Commandments; sermons, verse in; translations
_description: The Ten Commandments, a tag in the Fasciculus morum — 10 lines in couplets

Bod187.First Lines:
Take no god but on in heuenNeme nat hys name yn ydyl
                    steuyn…
Bod187.Last Lines:
…þy neyburs gud þu ne willeNe wyf ne dowtyr for to
                    spylle

Bod410.First Lines:
Take no god but on in heuen take not his nome In yvel
                    steuen…
Bod410.Last Lines:
…þi nekburgh good þu shall not wyllehis wyf his
                    doughter þu shalt not spille
Bod410.Editions:
Little,  Andrew George. 
             Studies in English Franciscan History.
         Manchester: Manchester UP; London: Longman’s, 1917: 150, n. 1.

BodLauMis213.First Lines:
Take no god but on in heuynTake not his name in ydyll
                    steuen…
BodLauMis213.Last Lines:
…þy neybour good þu schalt not wyllehys wyf hys
                    dowter thow schalt nott spyll

BodLauMis568.First Lines:
Tak noo god bot on in heuynNeme noght hys nome in ydyl
                    steuyn…
BodLauMis568.Last Lines:
…thy neyburs gode ne þou wyllNe wyffe ne doghter ne
                    mayden more for to spul

BodRawC670.First Lines:
Take no god but oon in heuenNeme nouȝt his name in ydel
                    steuen…
BodRawC670.Last Lines:
…Þin neyyborus godes þou ne wyllNy wyf ne
                    douȝtur for to spylle
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 155.

CamGon71.First Lines:
Worschip no god bot one in heuenTake not hys name in hidel
                    steuen…
CamGon71.Last Lines:
…þi negthbor gud in no willNo wyff ne doghtre
                    for to spill

CamStJohn159.First Lines:
Take no gode bot one in heueneNeuyne not hys name in ydil
                    steuyne…
CamStJohn159.Last Lines:
…þi neghbures gude þu ne wyllne wyf no doghter for
                    to spill

EDU82.First Lines:
Take noo god but oone in heuenNym nott his name in ydel
                    steven…
EDU82.Last Lines:
…Thes been the hestes of grettest medeKepe hem well ȝif
                    thou wultt spede

Lincoln44.First Lines:
Take non god bute on þu heueneNeme noth his name in hydyl
                    steueneKepe ryȝt wel þy holy dayþy fadur þy modur
                    þu worchep ay…
Lincoln44.Last Lines:
…þy nethbours goud þu ne willene wyfe ne
                    þouȝter forto spille

GraysInn15.Transcription:
[T]Ake no god but on in hewene[N]Ame nowth his name in hydis
                    stewene[L]Oke ryth wel þin halyday[N]E fals wytnesse þow ne
                    beer[Þ]Ow schalt don non lecherye[N]E non thefte of
                    felonye[Þ]in neyȝebour godus þou ne wille[N]E wyf ne
                    dowtyr for to spylle[W]yt hem wel and þou schalt spede
GraysInn15.Note:
12 lines, with additional couplet similar to 5103-8. Guide letters
                    indicate unexecuted initial letters.

WorcF19.First Lines:
Take non god bot on in heueneNem noȝt his name in ydyl
                    steuene…
WorcF19.Last Lines:
…Þy neghebor god þu ne willeNe wyfe ne douȝter
                    for to spille
WorcF19.Editions:
Wilson,  J. M. 
             “Worcester Cathedral Library, from the Report of the Librarian, Canon J.
                M. Wilson.” 
             The Library
         4th ser. 2 (1921-22): 257-65: 263.
